subject: Data
title: Rates vs. Raw Numbers: Context Matters
description: One-minute skill: Rates vs. Raw Numbers: Context Matters.

hook.text: Country A has 10,000 car accidents. Country B has 5,000. Which is safer? You can't tell without population.

buildup.text: Raw numbers without context are meaningless. Rates â€” per capita, per 100,000 â€” allow fair comparison.

discovery.text: Country A has 100 million people (10 per 100K). Country B has 1 million (500 per 100K). B is far more dangerous.

twist.text: News headlines almost always use raw numbers because big numbers are more alarming than small rates.

climax.text: Converting raw numbers to rates is the simplest and most powerful data literacy skill you can learn.

punchline.text: A big number without a denominator is just noise.

quiz.question: Why are per-capita rates more useful than raw numbers?
options: They allow fair comparisons across different-sized populations
